docs.lead_paragraph: What comes to mind when someone says the word war? For Adbul Hakeem Paigir, 14, from Afghanistan, the response was simple and solemn. ''Wives without husbands, children without parents,'' he said, bathed in a warm white spotlight. ''People forced out of their homes.''

headline.main: How Children Experience War and Its Consequences

docs.abstract: Edward Rothstein column on fairy tales in light of publication of The Annotated Classic Fairy Tales, edited by Maria Tatar; warns against seeking simple meaning from these tales; photo; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Ivan Illich, a onetime Roman Catholic priest who, through a steady flow of books and articles preached counterintuitive sociology to a disquieted baby-boom generation, died on Monday at his home in Bremen, Germany. He was 76. Celia Samerski, a student of his at the University of Bremen, said the specific cause of death was not known. She said he also had a home in Cuernavaca, Mexico.
docs.abstract: Ivan Illich, onetime Roman Catholic priest who preached counterintuitive sociology to baby-boom generation, dies at age 76; photo (M)
